fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.vars

Class Value<Type>

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.vars.Value<Type>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TimedValueI
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    DerivableValue

    public class Value<Type>
extends java.lang.Object
implements TimedValueI
    The class Value defines a placeholder for the values of atomic HIOA models with a history mechanism that memorise immediately preceding values within a predefined time window.

    Description

    The class is meant to serve as indirection for the value of variables that are shared among the model (unique by rule) that exports them and models that import them. Because variables take different values over the simulation time, a simulation time is attached to each value when it is computed (i.e., when the variable is assigned a new value).

    The class also defines a history mechanism able to memorise values of the variable over time. The size of the history can be set when creating the instance of Value. However, the class does not define any processing for these values. Subclasses should therefore introduce such processing, like means to predict values at a given time, either interpolating between memorised values or extrapolating outside the time interval covered by memorised values.

    Because the models can be executed in real time, aka with concurrent tasks triggered by a real time scheduler, accesses to values must be protected by a lock (for most operations).

    Glass-box Invariants

     invariant       owner != null
 invariant       timeUnit.equals(owner.getSimulatedTimeUnit())
 invariant       descriptor == null || owner == descriptor.owner
 invariant       valueLock != null
 invariant     time == null || time.getTimeUnit().equals(timeUnit)

    Black-box Invariants

     invariant       getOwner().getSimulatedTimeUnit().equals(getTimeUnit())

    Created on : 2018-04-03

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

        public Value(AtomicHIOA owner)
        create a value instance for the given variable and the given owner with an initial value but without history.

        Contract

         pre     owner != null
 post    owner == getOwner()
 post    !isVariableDescriptorSet()
 post    getTime() == null
 post    !isInitialised()
 post    !hasValueHistory()
        Parameters:
        owner - model owning the variable.

      • Value

        public Value(AtomicHIOA owner,
             Duration historyWindow,
             ValueHistoryFactoryI<Type> valueHistoryFactory)
        create a value instance for the given variable and the given owner with an initial value computed at the given initial time and with the given history size.

        Contract

         pre     owner != null
 pre     historyWindow == null || historyWindow.greaterThan(Duration.zero(historyWindow.getTimeUnit()))
 pre     historyWindow == null || owner.getSimulatedTimeUnit() == historyWindow.getTimeUnit()
 pre     historyWindow == null && valueHistoryFactory == null || historyWindow != null && valueHistoryFactory != null
 post    owner == getOwner()
 post    !isVariableDescriptorSet()
 post    getTime() == null
 post    !isInitialised()
 post    historyWindow == null ? !hasValueHistory() : hasValueHistory()
        Parameters:
        owner - model owning the variable.
        historyWindow - time window governing the size of the history.
        valueHistoryFactory - factory to create an history of the values.

      • initialiseTime

        public void initialiseTime(Time initialTime)
        initialise the simulated time associated to the initial value, when the latter has been set by the constructor (i.e., before the initial time of the simulation is known); this will not trigger a push in the value history even if one is present, rather use setNewValue to force a push.

        Contract

         pre     initialTime != null
 pre     initialTime.getTimeUnit().equals(getTimeUnit())
 pre     initialTime.greaterThanOrEqual(Time.zero(getTimeUnit()))
 post    getTime().equals(initialTime)
        Parameters:
        initialTime - simulated time at which the initial value corresponds.

      • setNewValue

        public void setNewValue(Type v,
                        Time t)
        set a new value for this Value object; safer but less efficient to use than modifying the variables v and time directly; mandatory when using a value history.

        Contract

         pre     isInitialised()
 pre     t != null && t.getTimeUnit().equals(getTimeUnit())
 pre     getTime() != null && t.greaterThanOrEqual(getTime())
 post    getValue().equals(v)
 post    getTime().equals(t)
        Parameters:
        v - new value to be set.
        t - time at which the new value corresponds.

         pre     isInitialised()
 post    !isInitialised()

      • evaluateAt

        public Type evaluateAt(Time t)
        get a value at time t for this Value object; safer but less efficient to use than accessing the variable v directly; mandatory when using a value history with an interpolation or extrapolation scheme. This implementation returns the evaluation returned by the history if there is one; if there is no history, the current value is returned, regardless of t.

        Contract

         pre     t != null && t.getTimeUnit().equals(getTimeUnit())
 post    true        // no postcondition.
        Parameters:
        t - time at which the value is required.
        Returns:
        the value for this Value object for the time t.
